compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (1) Review your Personal Data
compliant.article numbers: 15 (Right of access by the data subject)
compliant.legal provisions: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and certain information.

compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (2) Request UMC to provide duplicates of your Personal Data
compliant.article numbers: 15 (Right of access by the data subject)
compliant.legal provisions: The controller shall provide a copy of the personal data undergoing processing.

compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (3) Request to supplement or correct your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning him or her.

compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (4) Transfer your Personal Data to other Personal Data controllers under reasonable and feasible measures
compliant.legal provisions: The data subject shall have the right to receive the personal data concerning him or her, which he or she has provided to a controller, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller without hindrance from the controller to which the personal data have been provided.

compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (6) Request to opt-out, including the following rights: Withdrawing your consent to process your Personal Data: please note that the withdrawal of your consent will not affect the legality of UMC's processing of your Personal Data based on your prior consent. If the processing of your Personal Data has other legal standings, UMC may continue to process your Personal Data.
compliant.article numbers: 7 (Conditions for consent), 17 (Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'))
compliant.legal provisions: Where processing is based on consent, the data subject shall have the right to withdraw his or her consent at any time.  The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.

compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (6) Request to opt-out, including the following rights: Request to delete your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning him or her without undue delay and the controller shall have the obligation to erase personal data without undue delay where one of a number of grounds applies.

compliant.section: 15. Cookies and other similar technologies - When you visit our website or log in systems, we may set cookies on your device or read the cookies which are on your device based on legal requirements or your clear consent.
compliant.article numbers: 5 (Principles relating to processing of personal data), 7 (Conditions for consent)
compliant.legal provisions: Personal data shall be: (a) processed lawfully, fairly and transparently in relation to the data subject ('lawfulness, fairness and transparency')  (f) processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures ('integrity and confidentiality'). Consent of the data subject means any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which he or she, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signifies agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her.

non_compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (5) In light of the compliance of applicable laws, you have the right to object to a third party who processes your Personal Data on behalf of UMC.
non_compliant.article numbers: 13 (Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject), 21 (Right to object)
non_compliant.legal provisions:
Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing.  

**Amend**:  Clarify the right to object to processing based on legitimate interests (Article 6(1)(f)) or public interest (Article 6(1)(e)).  The policy should state that individuals have the right to object to such processing and that processing should cease unless the controller demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the data subject or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.
non_compliant.amend: In light of the compliance with applicable laws, you have the right to object to a third party who processes your Personal Data on behalf of UMC.  You have the right to object to processing, including profiling, where UMC is relying on legitimate interest or public interest as the legal basis for processing.  If you object, UMC will no longer process your personal data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override your interests, rights and freedoms or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.

non_compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (6) Request to opt-out, including the following rights: Refusal of providing your Personal Data. However, please note that if you refuse to provide your Personal Data, UMC may not be able to provide you our products or services in complete.
non_compliant.article numbers: 13 (Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject)
non_compliant.legal provisions:
At the time when personal data are obtained, the controller shall provide the data subject with certain information, including: (e) the consequences of not providing the personal data. 

**Amend**:  Specify the consequences of not providing personal data in a more transparent and granular way.  Instead of a general statement, explain which specific products or services might be unavailable and why.
non_compliant.amend: Refusal of providing your Personal Data.  Please note that if you refuse to provide certain personal data, we may not be able to provide you with some of our products or services.  For example, if you do not provide your payment information, you will not be able to purchase products through our website.  We will inform you about the specific consequences of not providing your personal data when we collect it from you.

non_compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (6) Request to opt-out, including the following rights: Stop Collecting your Personal Data.
non_compliant.article numbers: 17 (Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'), 18 (Right to restriction of processing)
non_compliant.legal provisions:
The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning him or her without undue delay and the controller shall have the obligation to erase personal data without undue delay where one of a number of grounds applies. The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller restriction of processing where one of a number of grounds applies. 

**Amend**:  Distinguish between the right to erasure and the right to restriction of processing.  Clarify that 'Stop Collecting your Personal Data' may fall under either right depending on the specific circumstances and the legal basis for processing.
non_compliant.amend: Stop Collecting your Personal Data.  You may have the right to request that we stop collecting your personal data.  This may involve deleting your data (right to erasure) or restricting the processing of your data (right to restriction of processing), depending on the specific circumstances and the legal basis for processing.  We will assess your request and inform you about the applicable rights and our actions.

non_compliant.section: 14. Data Subject Rights - (6) Request to opt-out, including the following rights: Restrict the Processing of your Personal Data.
non_compliant.legal provisions:
The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller restriction of processing where one of a number of grounds applies. 

**Amend**:  Explain the conditions for restricting processing and the potential consequences.
non_compliant.amend: Restrict the Processing of your Personal Data.  You may have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data in certain circumstances, such as when you contest the accuracy of your data or when you have objected to processing based on legitimate interests.  If we restrict processing, we will only process your data for limited purposes, such as storage.  We will inform you before lifting any restriction of processing.

non_compliant.section: 16. Direct marketing - UMC may use your e-mail and other Personal Data to provide you information that may be of interest to you, including but not limited to business sustainability and corporate social responsibility. When UMC provides you with the foregoing information, UMC may use the contact information provided by you. You can unsubscribe at any time via the emails sent to UMC. After canceling the subscription, UMC will no longer send unsubscribed information to you.
non_compliant.legal provisions:
Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing. 

**Amend**:  Clarify that individuals have the right to object to direct marketing *from the outset* (at the time of data collection) and not just at a later stage.  Provide an easy way to opt out of direct marketing, such as a clear and prominent unsubscribe link in every marketing email.
non_compliant.amend: 16. Direct marketing - UMC may use your e-mail and other Personal Data to provide you information that may be of interest to you, including but not limited to business sustainability and corporate social responsibility.  We will only send you marketing communications if you have opted in to receive them.  You have the right to object to receiving direct marketing at any time.
